description: Endo H cleaves asparagine-linked hybrid or high mannose oligosaccharides but not complex oligosaccharides.Endo H cleaves Asparagine-linked hybrid or high mannose oligosaccharides, but not complex oligosaccharides. It cleaves between the two N-acetylglucosamine residues in the diacetylchitobiose core of the oligosaccharide, generating a truncated sugar molecule with one N-acetylglucosamine residue remaining on the asparagine. In contrast, PNGase F removes the oligosaccharide intact. Detergent and heat denaturation may increase the rate of cleavage for some glycoproteins.Contents:60 µL aliquot of enzyme (300 mU) in 20 mM Tris-HCl, 25 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA (pH 7.5).200 µL 5x Reaction Buffer 5.5 (250 mM sodium phosphate, pH 5.5)Denaturation Solution - 2% SDS, 1 M Beta-mercaptoethanol
name: Endoglycosidase H
